title: These Are the Best Korean Sunscreens to Protect Your Skin From Wrinkles, Spots, and Damage

Best Overall

KraveBeauty Beet The Sun SPF 40 PA+++

Pros

  • Slim, travel-friendly tube
  • No white cast
  • Hydrating

Cons

  • May not be suitable for very acne-prone skin

“I’m madly in love with this chemical SPF,” says Lee. “The creamy texture melts into the skin and looks and feels practically invisible, no matter how much I apply. If I had to only choose one sunscreen to use for the rest of my life, this would be it.” The formula is also supercharged with beetroot extract, which is packed with antioxidants and protects the skin against wrinkle- and dark spot-causing free radicals. If you hate sunscreen, it’s because you haven’t tried this one.

Key ingredients: Beetroot extract

Size: 1.7 fl. oz.

SPF: 40+

Amazon rating: 4.5/5 stars

An Amazon reviewer says: “I’ve tried so many sunscreens (high-end and drugstore), and this is the best one I’ve ever tried! I have dry/combination skin with mild acne. This applies as a second moisturizer and does not leave a white cast at all (I have a medium skin tone). This is easy to reapply, and the tube lasts a while. I use it every day and I only have to buy it every few months.”

Best for All Skin Tones

Innisfree Daily UV Defense Sunscreen SPF 36

Pros

  • No white cast, so it works on deeper skin

This water-based formula is lightweight and gentle on the skin while providing protection against UV rays. Featuring nourishing sunflower seed oil and anti-inflammatory green tea, it also works to minimize the appearance of fine lines and hyperpigmentation.

Key ingredients: Green tea, sunflower seed oil, cica

Size: 1.69 fl. oz.

    SPF: 36

    Amazon rating: 4.6/5 stars

    An Amazon reviewer says: “I've used this for months and it never broke me out. It plays well with my makeup/skin care, blends in so easily, and leaves no white cast. My skin is so dewy.”

    Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

    Best TikTok-Viral Brand

    Beauty of Joseon Daily Relief Sunscreen

    Pros

    • Non-comedogenic
    • Suitable for all skin types

    Most people would probably agree that Beauty of Joseon is the most popular sunscreen brand on TikTok. The original Relief Sun sunscreen became a viral sensation a few years ago, and it seemed like anybody who tried it loved it. However, counterfeit ones soon began popping up all over the place. “Additionally, since some of the advanced filters used in Korean sunscreens don’t comply with the FDA’s (outdated) regulations, Beauty of Joseon wasn’t able to directly sell via American retailers,” Lee says. However, the brand has finally formulated a U.S.-exclusive sunscreen that retains the beloved qualities of the original—like its lightweight hydration, non-comedogenic formula, and lack of white cast—while being FDA-approved.

    Size: 1.69 fl. oz.

    SPF: 40

    Amazon rating: 4.3/5 stars

    An Amazon reviewer says: “This sunscreen has worked great for my olive-toned skin. It leaves no white cast and is lightweight. I love that I can apply this sunscreen over my moisturizers without experiencing any peeling. I can apply makeup over this sunscreen without having to deal with any white cast or peeling. I will definitely be repurchasing this!”

    Best Mineral Sunscreen

    Etude Sunprise Mild Airy Finish Sun Milk SPF50+ / PA+++

    Pros

    • Works well underneath makeup

    Cons

    • Not best for dry skin

    An Amazon favorite, this sunscreen boasts a milky formula and contains 100 percent mineral ingredients that protect the skin from UV rays. It’s especially great for those with combination and oily skin, as it offers a super airy texture that dries down quickly.

    Key ingredients: Aloe vera, Barbados cherry

    Size: 1.76 fl. oz.

    SPF: 50+

    Amazon rating: 4.2/5 stars

    An Amazon reviewer says: “It leaves a silky natural matte finish, though not too matte that I can’t wear it during winter months. It wears flawlessly under makeup and doesn’t irritate my eyes if I happen rub them shortly after applying."

    Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

    Best Sunscreen Stick

    Round Lab Birch Juice Moisturizing Sun Stick

    Pros

    • Travel-friendly
    • Convenient, hands-free application

    Cons

    • May run out relatively quickly

    “Because I have to test so many formulas for my job, I often hop from sunscreen to sunscreen and have a bunch of them open at once,” says Lee. “So if I actually finish a sunscreen, I know that I like it, and this is one of the lucky few. The stick format makes it incredibly easy to apply just the right amount to every inch of your face, and it’s nice and compact for travel—it was the one sunscreen I brought on multiple trips last year. The formula also feels like nothing on the skin yet leaves it with a slight glow.”

    Key ingredients: Birch tree extra, aloe, kelp extract, hyaluronic acid, peptides, niacinamide

    Size: 1.97 oz fl. oz.

    SPF: 50+

    Yesstyle rating: 4.2/5 stars

    A Yesstyle reviewer says: “If you’re Black and want to use Korean sunscreens, you have to buy this! It leaves no white cast, and it gives you the protection you need from the sun. This is my second purchase. I have acne, and my skin is either oily or combination.”

    Best Tinted Sunscreen

    Missha M Perfect Cover BB Cream

    Pros

    • Buildable coverage
    • Acne-prone skin-friendly

    Cons

    • Some may dislike scent
    • Limited shade range

    This product is the epitome of convenience—it’s essentially a moisturizer, sunscreen, and foundation all rolled into one. “I’ve written about this BB cream so many times, and it only seems to get more popular,” says Lee. “I like its smooth, hydrating texture and the fact that I don’t have to wear any complexion makeup products when I wear it.”

    Key ingredients: Hyaluronic acid, ceramides, botanical extracts

    Size: 1.69 oz fl. oz.

    SPF: 42+

    Amazon rating: 4.3/5 stars

    An Amazon reviewer says: “Since wearing this daily, I’ve been getting many compliments at work on how clear my skin is looking. I tell them it’s a new foundation, and they seem surprised and say it looks like naturally good skin. I normally wear foundation every day, but I don’t ever get comments, so this is probably going to replace my foundation, even though I have to mix shades every time. If so many people are noticing the improvement, it’s probably worth the hassle!”

    Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

    Best for Sensitive Skin

    Anua Heartleaf Silky Moisture Mild Sunscreen

    Pros

    • Non-greasy
    • Fragrance-free

    Those with sensitive, acne-prone skin may hesitate to use sunscreen on their faces for fear of breaking out. Anua’s ultra-gentle sunscreen actually soothes irritation instead of causing it with calming heartleaf extract and hydrating hyaluronic acid.

    Key ingredients: Hyaluronic acid, ceramides, botanical extracts

    Size: 1.69 oz fl. oz.

    SPF: 42+

    Amazon rating: 4.3/5 stars

    An Amazon reviewer says: “This is by far my favorite face sunscreen! The formula has a refreshing lightweight feel but still offers amazing coverage. Also, it doesn’t make me break out, which is amazing and rare considering how sensitive my skin is. 10/10 recommend!”

    Best for Layering

    Make P:rem UV Defense Me Blue Ray Sun Gel SPF 50+ / PA++++

    Pros

    • Lightweight, non-oily finish

    Cons

    • Some may prefer a mineral sunscreen

    This Korean gel sunscreen simultaneously moisturizes and protects the skin without feeling oily or sticky—making it great to layer underneath makeup. According to the brand, it’s also clinically proven to be safe for even those with reactive skin.

    Key ingredients: Fructan, bamboo water, city proof complex, lespedeza capitata leaf extract

    Size: 2.53 fl. oz.

    SPF: 50+

    Amazon rating: 4.4/5 stars

    An Amazon reviewer says: “I really enjoy using this sunblock. It’s moisturizing (which is great for my dry skin), provides ample sun protection, and doesn’t feel heavy or sticky. It has a light fragrance which is pleasant and not overbearing.”

    Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

    Best for Under Makeup

    Cosrx Vitamin E Vitalizing Sunscreen SPF 50+

    Pros

    • No white cast
    • Deeply hydrating

    Cons

    • May not be suitable for acne-prone skin

    “I hate when you apply your foundation or concealer over sunscreen and everything starts peeling,” says Lee. “This one won’t do that, plus it’s a chemical SPF that won’t give you a white cast.” The vitamin E inside the formula also combats free-radicals, which can come from the sun’s rays and cause premature signs of aging like fine lines, hyperpigmentation, and sagging.

    Key ingredients: Fructan, bamboo water, city proof complex, lespedeza capitata leaf extract

    Size: 2.53 fl. oz.

    SPF: 50+

    Amazon rating: 4.4/5 stars

    An Amazon reviewer says: “I wish that I would have found this product sooner. I have very fair skin, and I get sunburned very easily. This sunscreen gives me the coverage that I need to avoid getting sunburned. I usually don’t like putting sunscreens on my face because they make my skin oily. This product doesn’t do that. My skin feels super smooth after each use.”

    Best Instantly Brightening

    Espoir Water Splash Sun Cream

    Cons

    • May not be suitable for darker skin tones

    Offering both necessary UVA and UVB protection, this Korean formula has a creamy, gel-like consistency that’s designed to leave behind a glowy, slightly brightening finish. The sunscreen also includes ceramides to give your skin barrier a boost.

    Key ingredients: Ceramides

    Size: 2 fl. oz.

    SPF: 50+

    Amazon rating: 4.2/5 stars

    An Amazon reviewer says: “I ordered this three times already. It has a healthy, glowy, not glittery finish.”

    Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

    Best for travel

    St. Mege Rice Korean Lightweight Sunscreen - Daily 50+ PA++++

    Pros

    • Lightweight and non-oily

    Pack this Korean sunscreen in your makeup case to shield your skin from UVA/UVB rays and maintain a balanced complexion. It stars rice extract to nourish and probiotics to support the skin’s natural barrier. Per reviewers, it offers a second-skin finish.

    Key ingredients: Rice extract, grain derived probiotics

    Size: 2 fl. oz.

    SPF: 50+

    Amazon rating: 4.4/5 stars

    An Amazon reviewer says: “This is my new favorite sunscreen! It goes on clear and soaks into the skin pretty quickly, leaving no film or residue. My skin responds really nicely to rice-based products, so I will definitely be buying this again!”

    Best for Barrier Protection

    ThankYou Farmer Sun Project Light Sun Essence

    Cons

    • May feel too heavy for some

    Not only does this formula protect against UVA and UVB rays, but it’s also hydrating and helps repair the skin barrier, thanks to ingredients like aloe leaf extract.

    Key ingredients: Portulaca oleracea, lime, and aloe leaf

    Size: 40mL

    SPF: 50

    Amazon rating: 4.6/5 stars

    An Amazon reviewer says: “This is hands down my favorite sunscreen, and I’ve trialed a LOT over the last ten years while delving into Korean skin care as a hobby. This sunscreen is so emollient and moisturizing that you can get away with not applying anything else underneath if you're in a hurry or just planning to go outside without bothering to put on a full face of makeup. It’s very flattering.”

    Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

    You should know...

    K-beauty prioritizes sunscreen.

    What is the essential step in the K-beauty skin care regimen? The application of sunscreen. “In Asia, the concept of daily usage of sunscreen dates way back,” Shieh explains. “Daily sunscreen wear has been a prevalent practice that has been passed down for many generations already. It’s been considered to be more as a part of the skin care routine to prevent sun damage rather than an extra step for outdoor occasions to prevent sunburn.”

    Korean sunscreens are comparable to skin care.

    Thanks to advanced technology and ingredients, Korean sunscreen has a similar texture and feel to regular skin care products. “When compared to traditional western sunscreens, K-beauty sunscreen formulations are a lot more lightweight and more like skin care,” Shieh says. “It’s also common for users to carry around a cushion compact for easy reapplication of sunscreen (or a foundation with SPF) throughout the day.”

    Korean sunscreens offer more coverage.

    When it comes to the broad spectrum rating system, Korea differs from the U.S. “SPF value indicates the level of UVB protection, which is responsible for causing sunburn on the skin, while UVA penetrates deeper into the skin and causes damage that leads to extrinsic aging,” Shieh explains. “Both Korea and the U.S. use the same SPF numbering system to indicate UVB protection level. However, when it comes to the UVA protection level, Korea uses the P.A. system. So when you look at a sunscreen sold in Korea, you need to make sure that both SPF and P.A. levels are indicated to know that the sunscreen protects the skin against both (SPF 50+/PA ++++).”

    The U.S. doesn’t follow the P.A. system for UVA. “If a sunscreen covers both UVB and UVA protection, it would be labeled as ‘broad spectrum’ along with the SPF value,” Shieh adds.

    Michelle Shieh is the scientific communications manager at Amorepacific US.
